intro: Garnotia griffithii, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Garnotia griffithii has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens with suitable climates.
